result.execSummary:
The defendant Santino Tyrell Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Santino Tyrell Ward is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Santino Tyrell Ward was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve  120 DAYS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 46  days time served. NO  Huber privileges. COURT OBJECTS TO ES.

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 7-6-15 or, if not paid, civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant. 

Court objects to expungment .
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, 46 days credit time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Santino Tyrell Ward

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Santino Tyrell Ward in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Santino Tyrell Ward in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

 The Court ordered the Defendant to serve  120 DAYS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 46  days time served. NO  Huber privileges. COURT OBJECTS TO ES.

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 7-6-15 or, if not paid, civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant. 

Court object to expungment . 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Santino Tyrell Ward in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Santino Tyrell Ward in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT ONE: 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

ON MOTION OF THE STATE, COURT ORDERED COUNT TWO:  DISMISSED AND READ IN.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. LR  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-04-2015 at 08:30 am.
State filed jury instructions; witness list;motion in limine. lr
Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 47. LR  Jury trial scheduled for 04-22-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Santino Tyrell Ward not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defense motion to modify bail argued and DENIED by the Court. Bail: $150.00 CASH TO REMAIN.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with NIAIRA C.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Santino Tyrell Ward in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Santino Tyrell Ward in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant HAS A LOWER PENDING CASE AND is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
